responses.question_text: Do you have ISO 27001 certification?
responses.answer_text: Yes, TechStart Inc. achieved ISO 27001:2022 certification in March 2024. We undergo annual surveillance audits by BSI Group, with our next audit scheduled for Q1 2025.

responses.question_text: What is your SOC 2 compliance status?
responses.answer_text: TechStart Inc. maintains SOC 2 Type II compliance covering all five Trust Service Criteria (Security, Availability, Processing Integrity, Confidentiality, and Privacy). Our 2024 report is available upon request.
responses.evidence: SOC 2 Type II Report - January 2024 to December 2024

responses.question_text: How do you handle GDPR compliance?
responses.answer_text: We maintain full GDPR compliance with an appointed EU Representative and DPO. We have implemented privacy-by-design, conducted DPIA for all processing activities, and established streamlined data subject request workflows.

responses.question_text: What encryption standards do you use?
responses.answer_text: TechStart uses AES-256-GCM for data at rest and TLS 1.3 with ChaCha20-Poly1305 cipher suite for data in transit. All encryption keys are managed via AWS KMS with automatic rotation.

responses.question_text: Do you support multi-factor authentication?
responses.answer_text: Yes, we enforce MFA across all user accounts using TOTP authenticators (Google Authenticator, Authy), hardware tokens (YubiKey), and biometric authentication. MFA bypass is not permitted.

responses.question_text: What is your data backup frequency?
responses.answer_text: We perform continuous database replication with 5-minute point-in-time recovery, automated daily snapshots, and weekly full backups retained for 365 days across three geographic regions.

responses.question_text: How often do you conduct penetration testing?
responses.answer_text: TechStart conducts bi-annual external penetration tests by Offensive Security certified professionals and monthly automated vulnerability scans. Critical vulnerabilities are remediated within 48 hours.

responses.question_text: What is your incident response time?
responses.answer_text: Our Security Operations Center operates 24/7/365 with a guaranteed 10-minute acknowledgment time for critical alerts and 30-minute initial response SLA for security incidents.

responses.question_text: Do you have a Business Continuity Plan?
responses.answer_text: Yes, our BCP includes multi-region failover with 2-hour RTO and 15-minute RPO. We conduct bi-annual tabletop exercises and annual full DR tests with documented results.

responses.question_text: What is your data retention policy?
responses.answer_text: Production data is retained per customer contract requirements (typically 7 years for compliance). Upon contract termination, data is securely deleted within 30 days using DoD 5220.22-M standard.

responses.question_text: How do you manage access control?
responses.answer_text: We implement Attribute-Based Access Control (ABAC) with zero-trust principles. All access is just-in-time (JIT) provisioned, time-bound, and requires business justification with manager approval.

responses.question_text: What security training do employees receive?
responses.answer_text: Employees complete monthly micro-learning security modules, quarterly phishing simulations, and annual role-specific security training. Developers receive OWASP Top 10 training. Completion is mandatory for performance reviews.

responses.question_text: Do you have a vulnerability management program?
responses.answer_text: Yes, we use continuous vulnerability scanning with Tenable and Qualys. Critical vulnerabilities are patched within 24 hours, high within 72 hours, medium within 30 days. Patch compliance is monitored via dashboard.

responses.question_text: What antivirus/endpoint protection do you use?
responses.answer_text: TechStart deploys CrowdStrike Falcon EDR on all endpoints with real-time protection, behavioral AI, threat hunting, and automated containment. All detections trigger SOC investigation.

responses.question_text: How do you secure your network?
responses.answer_text: Network security includes Palo Alto next-gen firewalls, micro-segmentation, IDS/IPS (Suricata), DDoS protection via Cloudflare, and zero-trust network access (ZTNA) for all internal resources.

responses.question_text: Do you perform background checks on employees?
responses.answer_text: Yes, all employees undergo comprehensive background screening including criminal records, credit check (for financial access roles), employment history, and education verification through Sterling Talent Solutions.

responses.question_text: What is your password policy?
responses.answer_text: Passwords require minimum 14 characters, complexity, and passphrase encouragement. Passwords are checked against Have I Been Pwned database. We encourage passwordless authentication via FIDO2 keys.

responses.question_text: Do you have a secure software development lifecycle?
responses.answer_text: Yes, our SDLC incorporates security gates at every phase: threat modeling (design), SAST (code), dependency scanning (build), DAST (test), and security sign-off before production deployment.

responses.question_text: How do you handle data breaches?
responses.answer_text: Our incident response plan includes breach notification within 72 hours per GDPR requirements, forensic investigation, customer notification, regulatory reporting, and root cause analysis with remediation tracking.

responses.question_text: What cloud providers do you use?
responses.answer_text: TechStart operates on AWS (primary) and Google Cloud Platform (DR/backup). Both environments are ISO 27001, SOC 2, and FedRAMP certified. We support customer-specified regions for data residency.

responses.question_text: Do you encrypt data in transit?
responses.answer_text: All data in transit uses TLS 1.3 exclusively with HSTS enforced. Certificate pinning is implemented for mobile applications. Legacy protocols (TLS 1.2 and below) are blocked at the firewall.

responses.question_text: How do you manage third-party vendor risk?
responses.answer_text: All vendors complete security questionnaires, provide SOC 2/ISO certifications, and undergo annual security reviews. Critical vendors are included in our business continuity planning and undergo on-site audits.

responses.question_text: What is your change management process?
responses.answer_text: Changes follow ITIL v4 framework with automated approval workflows, peer review, automated testing, canary deployments, and automated rollback capabilities. Emergency changes have expedited procedures with post-implementation review.

responses.question_text: Do you have a DDoS mitigation strategy?
responses.answer_text: Yes, we use Cloudflare Enterprise with automatic DDoS mitigation up to 100 Tbps, rate limiting, bot management, and WAF. We maintain runbooks for layer 7 application-layer attacks.

responses.question_text: How do you monitor system logs?
responses.answer_text: All logs are aggregated in Splunk Enterprise Security SIEM with real-time correlation, threat intelligence integration, and automated playbooks. Logs are immutable, encrypted, and retained for 13 months.

responses.question_text: What is your disaster recovery plan?
responses.answer_text: We maintain active-active multi-region deployment with automated failover. RTO is 2 hours for regional failure, 30 minutes for service-level failure. RPO is 5 minutes. DR tests occur quarterly with executive participation.

responses.question_text: Do you segregate customer data?
responses.answer_text: Yes, customer data is segregated using separate AWS accounts per customer (for enterprise clients) or separate RDS instances with schema-level isolation. Cross-customer data access is prevented via IAM policies.

responses.question_text: What database encryption do you use?
responses.answer_text: All databases use encryption at rest via AWS RDS encryption with AES-256. Encryption keys are managed in AWS KMS with automatic annual rotation. Field-level encryption is used for PII columns.

responses.question_text: How do you handle security patches?
responses.answer_text: Critical patches are deployed within 24 hours via automated pipelines, high-severity within 72 hours, and standard patches during bi-weekly maintenance windows. Patch compliance is tracked in ServiceNow.

responses.question_text: Do you have cyber insurance?
responses.answer_text: Yes, TechStart maintains $25M cyber liability coverage through Coalition Insurance, including first-party losses, third-party claims, regulatory defense, and breach response costs.

responses.question_text: What compliance frameworks do you follow?
responses.answer_text: We maintain compliance with ISO 27001, SOC 2 Type II, GDPR, CCPA, PIPEDA, and HIPAA. We are pursuing FedRAMP Moderate authorization for government clients.

responses.question_text: How do you protect against ransomware?
responses.answer_text: Ransomware protection includes immutable S3 backups, CrowdStrike EDR with behavioral detection, email sandboxing, application whitelisting on critical servers, and quarterly ransomware tabletop exercises.

responses.question_text: Do you perform code reviews?
responses.answer_text: All code requires mandatory peer review via pull requests with at least two approvals for production code. Security-critical changes undergo additional AppSec team review. Code review metrics are tracked.

responses.question_text: What is your data classification policy?
responses.answer_text: Data is classified as Public, Internal, Confidential, or Highly Confidential. Classification labels are automatically applied via DLP tools. Each level has specific encryption, access, and retention requirements.

responses.question_text: How do you ensure API security?
responses.answer_text: APIs implement OAuth 2.0 with JWT tokens, strict rate limiting (1000 req/min per API key), input validation, output encoding, and comprehensive logging. All APIs are protected by Cloudflare WAF with OWASP ruleset.

responses.question_text: Do you have a bug bounty program?
responses.answer_text: Yes, we operate a public bug bounty program on Bugcrowd with payouts ranging from $100 to $25,000 depending on severity. We have resolved 150+ vulnerabilities through the program since launch.

responses.question_text: What email security measures do you use?
responses.answer_text: Email security includes Proofpoint for advanced threat protection, SPF/DKIM/DMARC enforcement, URL rewriting, attachment sandboxing, and impersonation protection. DMARC policy is set to 'reject'.

responses.question_text: How do you handle cryptographic key management?
responses.answer_text: All cryptographic keys are generated and stored in AWS CloudHSM (FIPS 140-2 Level 3). Keys are automatically rotated every 90 days. Key usage is logged and monitored via CloudTrail.

responses.question_text: Do you have physical security controls?
responses.answer_text: Our offices use biometric access control, 24/7 CCTV with 90-day retention, visitor escort policies, and clean desk mandates. Data centers are SOC 2 certified with defense-in-depth physical security.

responses.question_text: What is your mobile device security policy?
responses.answer_text: All mobile devices are managed via Microsoft Intune MDM with mandatory encryption, biometric unlock, remote wipe, app containerization, and compliance policies. BYOD is prohibited for accessing sensitive data.

responses.question_text: How do you secure container deployments?
responses.answer_text: Container security includes Aqua Security for runtime protection, vulnerability scanning via Trivy, immutable infrastructure, rootless containers, secrets via AWS Secrets Manager, and Kubernetes network policies.

responses.question_text: Do you have a security incident escalation process?
responses.answer_text: Incidents are categorized as P0 (critical), P1 (high), P2 (medium), P3 (low) with defined escalation chains. P0 incidents trigger immediate executive notification and war room activation within 15 minutes.

responses.question_text: What data loss prevention measures do you have?
responses.answer_text: We deploy Symantec DLP across email, web, endpoints, and cloud with policies preventing PII/PCI data exfiltration. DLP alerts trigger automated case creation in ServiceNow for investigation.

responses.question_text: How do you ensure secure remote access?
responses.answer_text: Remote access requires Zscaler Private Access (ZPA) with device trust verification, MFA, and user/entity behavioral analytics. VPN is deprecated in favor of zero-trust ZTNA approach.

responses.question_text: What is your security audit frequency?
responses.answer_text: Annual SOC 2 audits, bi-annual ISO 27001 surveillance audits, quarterly internal security audits, and monthly compliance spot checks. All findings are tracked in GRC platform with remediation deadlines.

responses.question_text: How do you manage privileged access?
responses.answer_text: Privileged access is managed via CyberArk PAM with password vaulting, session recording, just-in-time access, and automatic password rotation. All privileged sessions are recorded and reviewed.

responses.question_text: Do you have a secure code repository?
responses.answer_text: Code is stored in GitHub Enterprise with branch protection, required status checks, signed commits, secret scanning, and Dependabot for dependency updates. Repository access follows least privilege.

responses.question_text: What threat intelligence do you use?
responses.answer_text: We integrate threat intelligence from MISP, AlienVault OTX, Recorded Future, and ISACs. Threat indicators are automatically imported into our SIEM and EDR for proactive blocking.

responses.question_text: How do you handle security exceptions?
responses.answer_text: Security exceptions require risk assessment, compensating controls, CISO approval, and are time-bound (maximum 90 days). All exceptions are tracked in our GRC platform with quarterly review.

responses.question_text: Do you perform security metrics tracking?
responses.answer_text: Yes, we track 50+ security KPIs including MTTD, MTTR, patch compliance, vulnerability aging, phishing click rates, and audit findings. Metrics are presented to the board quarterly.

responses.question_text: What is your data anonymization approach?
responses.answer_text: We use tokenization for production data in non-prod environments, k-anonymity for analytics datasets, and differential privacy for ML training data. PII is automatically detected and masked.

responses.question_text: How do you secure APIs at the network level?
responses.answer_text: APIs are accessible only via API Gateway with IP whitelisting, geo-blocking, DDoS protection, and WAF. Internal APIs use mutual TLS authentication and are not internet-accessible.

responses.question_text: Do you have asset inventory management?
responses.answer_text: All assets are tracked in ServiceNow CMDB with automated discovery via network scanning, cloud inventory APIs, and agent-based reporting. Unauthorized devices trigger quarantine.

responses.question_text: What is your approach to secrets management?
responses.answer_text: Secrets are stored in HashiCorp Vault with dynamic secret generation, automatic rotation, and audit logging. Hard-coded secrets are prevented via pre-commit hooks and automated scanning.

responses.question_text: How do you ensure supply chain security?
responses.answer_text: All dependencies are scanned via Snyk and GitHub Advanced Security. We maintain SBOM for all applications, verify package signatures, and use private npm/PyPI mirrors for approved packages only.

responses.question_text: Do you have a security champion program?
responses.answer_text: Yes, each engineering team has a designated security champion who receives advanced training, participates in security design reviews, and acts as liaison with the AppSec team.

responses.question_text: What is your approach to zero trust?
responses.answer_text: We implement zero trust via continuous verification, least privilege access, micro-segmentation, device trust, and assume breach posture. All resources require authentication regardless of network location.

responses.question_text: How do you handle secure deletion?
responses.answer_text: Data deletion follows NIST SP 800-88 guidelines with cryptographic erasure for encrypted data, overwrite methods for unencrypted data, and physical destruction for decommissioned media. Deletion is logged and verified.

responses.question_text: Do you have security awareness for executives?
responses.answer_text: Executives complete specialized security training covering board-level cyber risk, social engineering targeting executives, secure communication, and incident decision-making. Training occurs quarterly.

responses.question_text: What is your cloud security posture management?
responses.answer_text: We use Prisma Cloud for CSPM with continuous compliance monitoring against CIS benchmarks, automated remediation for critical misconfigurations, and integration with our ITSM for ticket creation.

responses.question_text: How do you perform security architecture reviews?
responses.answer_text: All new projects undergo security architecture review during design phase. Reviews assess threat model, data flows, authentication/authorization, encryption, and compliance requirements. Sign-off required before implementation.

responses.question_text: Do you have a red team program?
responses.answer_text: We conduct annual red team exercises simulating APT attacks, testing detection capabilities, incident response, and business continuity. Exercises include physical security, social engineering, and technical attacks.

responses.question_text: What is your approach to database activity monitoring?
responses.answer_text: We deploy Imperva DAM for real-time database activity monitoring, anomaly detection, SQL injection prevention, and privileged user monitoring. All database queries are logged and analyzed.

responses.question_text: How do you manage security debt?
responses.answer_text: Security debt is tracked in Jira with risk scoring, aging metrics, and sprint allocation requirements. Critical security debt must be addressed within 30 days and is prioritized above new features.

responses.question_text: Do you have insider threat detection?
responses.answer_text: Insider threat detection includes user behavior analytics (UEBA) via Splunk, privileged access monitoring, data exfiltration alerts, after-hours access monitoring, and HR integration for termination workflows.

responses.question_text: What is your security testing coverage?
responses.answer_text: 100% of production code undergoes SAST scanning, all web applications undergo annual DAST, infrastructure undergoes quarterly penetration testing, and containers are scanned pre-deployment.

responses.question_text: How do you ensure compliance in CI/CD?
responses.answer_text: CI/CD pipelines include security gates: secret scanning, SAST, dependency checks, container scanning, IaC security scanning, and compliance checks. Failed security checks block deployment.

responses.question_text: Do you have a secure configuration baseline?
responses.answer_text: All systems follow CIS benchmarks with automated compliance checking via Chef InSpec. Configuration drift triggers automatic remediation or alerts for manual review. Compliance is measured weekly.

responses.question_text: What is your approach to API versioning security?
responses.answer_text: Old API versions are deprecated with 6-month notice, sunset with security support only, and eventually decommissioned. Security patches are backported only to current and current-1 versions.

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for mergers and acquisitions?
responses.answer_text: M&A security due diligence includes technical assessment, compliance review, vulnerability scanning of target, data mapping, and 180-day integration security roadmap with risk acceptance for gaps.

responses.question_text: Do you have security orchestration and automation?
responses.answer_text: We use Phantom SOAR for automated incident response, threat intel enrichment, automated containment actions, and playbook-driven investigations. 60% of security alerts are handled via automation.

responses.question_text: What is your approach to security in DevOps?
responses.answer_text: DevSecOps practices include shift-left security, security champions in teams, automated security testing in pipelines, infrastructure as code security, and security metrics in team dashboards.

responses.question_text: How do you manage security for SaaS applications?
responses.answer_text: All SaaS apps undergo security assessment, SSO/SAML integration is mandatory, data access is monitored via CASB (Netskope), and SaaS usage is tracked with quarterly access reviews.

responses.question_text: Do you have network segmentation?
responses.answer_text: Network is segmented into DMZ, production, development, and management zones with firewalls between segments. Micro-segmentation is implemented for containerized workloads using Kubernetes network policies.

responses.question_text: What is your certificate management process?
responses.answer_text: All certificates are managed via Let's Encrypt with automated renewal 30 days before expiration. Certificate inventory is maintained with expiration monitoring and alerting. Private PKI uses AWS Certificate Manager.

responses.question_text: How do you ensure security in machine learning models?
responses.answer_text: ML security includes adversarial testing, model versioning and approval, input validation, output sanitization, model explainability, and data poisoning detection. Models undergo security review before production.

responses.question_text: Do you have a security governance framework?
responses.answer_text: Security governance includes quarterly board reporting, annual strategy review, risk committee oversight, security steering committee, and defined escalation paths. Framework aligns with NIST CSF.

responses.question_text: What is your data residency and sovereignty approach?
responses.answer_text: We support data residency in US, EU, UK, Canada, and Australia regions. Customer data does not cross regional boundaries. Metadata and encryption keys are also region-specific.

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for IoT devices?
responses.answer_text: IoT devices are isolated on separate VLAN, require certificate-based authentication, communicate via encrypted channels only, receive regular firmware updates, and are monitored for anomalous behavior.

responses.question_text: Do you have quantum-safe cryptography plans?
responses.answer_text: We are monitoring NIST post-quantum cryptography standards and have roadmap for quantum-safe algorithm adoption by 2026. Crypto-agility is built into our architecture for algorithm migration.

responses.question_text: What is your security incident lessons learned process?
responses.answer_text: All P0/P1 incidents undergo post-incident review within 5 business days with root cause analysis, timeline reconstruction, lessons learned documentation, and remediation action items with owners and deadlines.

responses.question_text: How do you ensure secure software dependencies?
responses.answer_text: Dependencies are scanned daily via Dependabot and Snyk. Critical vulnerabilities trigger automated PRs. We maintain approved package lists and use lock files. Transitive dependencies are also monitored.

responses.question_text: Do you have security metrics for executives?
responses.answer_text: Executive security dashboard includes: mean time to detect/respond, vulnerability closure rates, audit findings, security training completion, third-party risk scores, and security spending vs. budget.

responses.question_text: What is your approach to security in infrastructure as code?
responses.answer_text: IaC security includes Terraform/CloudFormation scanning via Checkov, policy as code enforcement using OPA, automated compliance checks, and GitOps workflows with pull request reviews for all changes.

responses.question_text: How do you handle data subject access requests?
responses.answer_text: DSAR requests are tracked in Privacy Management Platform with 30-day SLA. Automated data discovery, portability in machine-readable format, and deletion workflows with verification are implemented.

responses.question_text: Do you have security requirements for contractors?
responses.answer_text: Contractors undergo same background checks as employees, sign NDAs, receive security training, use contractor-specific accounts with time-limited access, and are offboarded within 24 hours of contract end.

responses.question_text: What is your security testing for APIs?
responses.answer_text: API security testing includes automated OWASP API Top 10 scanning, authentication/authorization testing, rate limiting verification, input fuzzing, and business logic testing. Testing occurs pre-release and quarterly.

responses.question_text: How do you ensure security in microservices?
responses.answer_text: Microservices security includes service mesh (Istio) for mTLS, API gateway authentication, distributed tracing for security events, secrets injection, and network policies. Each service has minimal privileges.

responses.question_text: Do you have a security research program?
responses.answer_text: Our security research team publishes findings, presents at conferences, contributes to open source security tools, and maintains threat research blog. Research informs our defensive strategies.

responses.question_text: What is your employee offboarding security process?
responses.answer_text: Offboarding includes immediate account deactivation, access revocation within 1 hour, device recovery, data transfer to manager, exit interview covering confidentiality, and 30-day monitoring of former employee access attempts.

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for remote workers?
responses.answer_text: Remote workers require company-managed devices with EDR, ZTNA for resource access, MFA, home network security guidance, video call security practices, and clear desk policy. Compliance is verified monthly.

responses.question_text: Do you have security requirements in vendor contracts?
responses.answer_text: All vendor contracts include security requirements: encryption standards, data handling, breach notification within 24 hours, annual security assessments, audit rights, and indemnification clauses.

responses.question_text: What is your security approach for blockchain/distributed ledger?
responses.answer_text: We do not currently use blockchain technology. If implemented, security would include smart contract audits, consensus mechanism security, private key management in HSMs, and DLT-specific threat modeling.

responses.question_text: How do you measure security culture?
responses.answer_text: Security culture is measured via quarterly surveys, phishing simulation results, security champion participation, security finding submission rates, and security training feedback. Results inform awareness programs.

responses.question_text: Do you have security playbooks for common scenarios?
responses.answer_text: Yes, we maintain 25+ security playbooks covering ransomware, DDoS, data breach, insider threat, credential compromise, supply chain attack, and other scenarios. Playbooks are tested during tabletop exercises.

responses.question_text: What is your security budget and resource allocation?
responses.answer_text: Security budget is 8% of IT spend with year-over-year 15% growth. Resources allocated: 40% tooling, 30% personnel, 20% external services, 10% training. Security headcount ratio is 1:25 (security:development).

responses.question_text: How do you handle security for acquisitions of other companies' data?
responses.answer_text: Acquired data undergoes security classification, encryption, access control implementation, data quality assessment, PII identification, and integration with our DLP and retention policies within 90 days.

responses.question_text: Do you have environmental security controls in data centers?
responses.answer_text: Data centers have fire suppression (FM-200), HVAC with redundancy, UPS and generators for power continuity, water leak detection, and environmental monitoring with 24/7 alerting.

responses.question_text: What is your security approach for APIs consumed from third parties?
responses.answer_text: Third-party APIs are assessed for security, use API keys stored in vault, communicate over TLS only, implement retry logic with backoff, have rate limiting handling, and are monitored for availability and anomalies.

responses.question_text: How do you handle security in your incident communications?
responses.answer_text: Incident communications follow templates, are reviewed by legal/PR for external communications, use encrypted channels (Signal), maintain confidentiality, provide timely updates to stakeholders, and include lessons learned summary.
